newsitem.title: THAILAND: Nortel wins $200 mln Thai phone deal.
newsitem.headline: Nortel wins $200 mln Thai phone deal.

text.p: Thai mobile phone operator, Wireless Communication Services Co Ltd (WCS), said on Wednesday it had awarded a telecommunication contract worth $200 million to Canada's Northern Telecom Ltd (Nortel).
Under the deal, Nortel will supply digital mobile phone switching and transmission equipment to WCS, Suradet Mukyangkoon, the WCS's Chairman of Executive Board, told Reuters.
WCS is a new mobile phone operator in Thailand in addition to Advanced Info Services Plc and Total Access Communication Plc.

The company's major shareholders are Total Access Communication and its units with 45 percent stake, International Engineering Plc with 35 percent and Thai Telecom Holding, a fund managed by Goldman Sachs with 18.9 percent.
The WCS expects to have 100,000 new mobile phone subscribers this year, Suradet said.
The company would also attempt to complete its digital mobile phone network throughout Bangkok and nearby provinces by the end of this year, he said.
